title: Anyone know any relatives of matrix?
content: I am trying to find a (literally) edgy serif. I have been trying to get matrix to work, but can't seem to manage. Any suggestions?
author: Thord

comments.content: Anything from that earlier thread suit your fancy?

Yes Stephen, thank you. Although I was hoping to find something with the same sort of simple geometric shapes, like the 45° lines, as in Matrix. I'm afraid I'm not very good at explaining this, but thank you all for trying.

Patty had the right idea with a search for "latin" fonts. These all have a pointed wedge serif. Here are [Latin fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416173701/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=latin) at FontShop.

Where will it be used? Text or headlines? Do you need various weights and widths? Italic? There isn't a more complete latin family than Matrix.

Xavier Dupré's [Zingha](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416173701/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=zingha) shares quite a few characteristics with Matrix. See also [my review for Typographer.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416173701/http:/www.typographer.org/2005_04_01_digests.html).
